alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jackson, southeastern Holmes and northeastern Washington Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bonifay, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chipley, Bonifay, Cottondale, Alford, Richter Crossroads, Chipley Municipal Airport, Orange Hill, Holmes County Airport, Ridgetop, Steele City, Round Lake, Cottondale Airport, Hulaw, Bahoma, Sunny Hills, Poplar Head, Johnson Crossroads and Jacob City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
